text: Young Harris is a city in Towns County, Georgia, United States. The population was 1,098 at the 2020 census. Young Harris is home to Young Harris College, after which it was named.New Georgia Encyclopedia-Towns County According to the United States Census Bureau, the city has a total area of , all land. As of the 2020 United States Census, there were 1,098 people living in the city. The racial makeup of the city was 78.5% White, 9.7% Black, 1.2% Asian, 7.7% from some other race and 2.9% from two or more races. 7.2% were Hispanic or Latino of any race. Former Governor and United States Senator Zell Miller (1932-2018) was born and died there. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Cities in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Young Harris, Georgia
